column1: Real Estate LTL Property Tracker Tableau Update Acquisition Method Change
column29: [Real Estate LTL Property Tracker: Views - Tableau Server|https://tableau.swift.com/#/site/KNX/workbooks/3737/views]
column126: '-Update LTL Property DS to include logic for change of Acquisition Method for doors (any change for count of doors up or down backfilled to that as the new acq method)
column172:
02/Sep/25 10:06 AM;Katey_harris@swifttrans.com;-- ========================================================================
-- PROPERTY TRACKING QUERY WITH ACQUISITION METHOD BACKFILL LOGIC
-- ========================================================================
-- PURPOSE: Analyzes property lifecycle events (activations/deactivations) forÂ 
-- property DH596 with intelligent backfill of acquisition methods.
--
-- KEY FEATURE: When users update acquisition methods, the new method backfills
-- to the last month where doors/acres actually changed, ensuring acquisitionÂ 
-- methods align with real capacity changes, not just record update timestamps.
-- ========================================================================

-- CTE 1: CLEANED_DATA
-- Standardizes and cleans raw property data from the tracking table
-- Actions: Trim whitespace, convert data types, create composite property keys
WITH cleaned_data AS (
Â  SELECTÂ 
Â  Â  -- Clean and standardize identifiers
Â  Â  TRIM(CAST(prop_id AS STRING)) AS prop_id,
Â  Â  TRIM(CAST(brand AS STRING)) AS brand,
Â  Â  TRIM(CAST(property_name AS STRING)) AS property_name,
Â  Â  -- Create composite property key for unique identification
Â  Â  CONCAT(TRIM(CAST(prop_id AS STRING)), TRIM(CAST(brand AS STRING)), TRIM(CAST(property_name AS STRING))) AS property,
Â  Â Â 
Â  Â  -- Clean address fields
Â  Â  TRIM(CAST(address AS STRING)) AS address,
Â  Â  TRIM(CAST(city AS STRING)) AS city,
Â  Â  TRIM(CAST(st AS STRING)) AS st,
Â  Â  TRIM(CAST(zip AS STRING)) AS zip,
Â  Â Â 
Â  Â  -- Property attributes and financial data
Â  Â  status,
Â  Â  sc_id,
Â  Â  acq_method, Â -- This will be backfilled in later steps
Â  Â  expansion_type,
Â  Â  deal_type,
Â  Â  own_lease,
Â  Â  doors, Â  Â  Â  -- Key metric for capacity tracking
Â  Â  acres, Â  Â  Â  -- Key metric for capacity tracking
Â  Â  price,
Â  Â  cost_per_door,
Â  Â  estimated_monthly_depreciation_per_rent,
Â  Â  startup_investment,
Â  Â  adj_cost_per_door,
Â  Â Â 
Â  Â  -- Convert date string to proper DATE format
Â  Â  CAST(TO_TIMESTAMP(acquisition_date, 'yyyy-MM-dd') AS DATE) AS acquisition_date,
Â  Â  activation_date,
Â  Â  deactivation_date,
Â  Â  notes,
Â  Â  insrt_ts Â  Â  -- Insert timestamp - critical for backfill logic
Â  FROM dev_ba.fac_ltl_prop_tracker_updt
Â  -- Exclude Revenue status properties from analysis
Â  WHERE status <> 'Revenue'
),

-- CTE 2: DATE_BOUNDS
-- Determines the active date range for each property to create monthly time series
-- Actions: Find earliest acquisition date and latest deactivation date (or current year-end)
date_bounds AS (
Â  SELECTÂ 
Â  Â  prop_id, brand, property_name,
Â  Â  CONCAT(TRIM(CAST(prop_id AS STRING)), TRIM(CAST(brand AS STRING)), TRIM(CAST(property_name AS STRING))) AS property,
Â  Â Â 
Â  Â  -- Start month: earliest acquisition date truncated to beginning of month
Â  Â  TRUNC(MIN(acquisition_date), 'MM') AS start_month,
Â  Â Â 
Â  Â  -- End month: latest deactivation date OR current year-end, whichever is earlier
Â  Â  LEAST(
Â  Â  Â  TRUNC(MAX(CASEÂ 
Â  Â  Â  Â  -- If deactivation_date is null or far future (2200-01-01), use current year-end
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHEN deactivation_date IS NULL OR deactivation_date >= DATE '2200-01-01'Â 
Â  Â  Â  Â  THEN ADD_MONTHS(TRUNC(NOW(), 'YY'), 11) Â -- December of current year
Â  Â  Â  Â  ELSE deactivation_dateÂ 
Â  Â  Â  END), 'MM'),
Â  Â  Â  ADD_MONTHS(TRUNC(NOW(), 'YY'), 11) Â -- Cap at current year-end
Â  Â  ) AS end_month
Â  FROM cleaned_data
Â  GROUP BY prop_id, brand, property_name
),

-- CTE 3: MONTH_SCAFFOLD
-- Creates a row for every month between start_month and end_month for each property
-- Actions: Generate continuous monthly time series to ensure no gaps in data
month_scaffold AS (
Â  SELECTÂ 
Â  Â  db.property,
Â  Â  db.prop_id, db.brand, db.property_name,
Â  Â  -- Create month_start date from the reference date table
Â  Â  TRUNC(CAST(CONCAT(r.yr_of_cal, '-', LPAD(r.mnth_of_yr, 2, '0'), '-01') AS DATE), 'MM') AS month_start
Â  FROM dev_ba.ref_date r
Â  JOIN date_bounds db
Â  Â  -- Only include months within the property's active date range
Â  Â  ON TRUNC(CAST(CONCAT(r.yr_of_cal, '-', LPAD(r.mnth_of_yr, 2, '0'), '-01') AS DATE), 'MM')
Â  Â  Â  Â BETWEEN db.start_month AND db.end_month
Â  -- Data quality filters for reference date table
Â  WHERE r.yr_of_cal IS NOT NULL
Â  Â  AND r.mnth_of_yr IS NOT NULL
Â  Â  AND CAST(r.yr_of_cal AS INT) BETWEEN 2000 AND 2100
Â  Â  AND CAST(r.mnth_of_yr AS INT) BETWEEN 1 AND 12
),

-- CTE 4: FIRST_RECORD
-- Gets the very first record for each property (earliest insert timestamp)
-- Actions: Used as fallback data when no records exist before a given month
first_record AS (
Â  SELECT *
Â  FROM (
Â  Â  SELECT *,
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY property ORDER BY insrt_ts ASC) AS rn
Â  Â  FROM cleaned_data
Â  ) sub
Â  WHERE rn = 1 Â -- Only the earliest record for each property
),

-- CTE 5: JOINED
-- Combines month scaffold with actual property data using point-in-time logic
-- Actions: For each month, get the latest record inserted before/on that month
joined AS (
Â  SELECTÂ 
Â  Â  m.property,
Â  Â  m.prop_id,
Â  Â  m.month_start,
Â  Â Â 
Â  Â  -- Use COALESCE to prefer actual data (b) over first_record fallback (f)
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.insrt_ts, f.insrt_ts) AS insrt_ts,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.sc_id, f.sc_id) AS sc_id,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.acq_method, f.acq_method) AS acq_method,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.expansion_type, f.expansion_type) AS expansion_type,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.deal_type, f.deal_type) AS deal_type,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.brand, f.brand) AS brand,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.property_name, f.property_name) AS property_name,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.address, f.address) AS address,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.city, f.city) AS city,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.st, f.st) AS st,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.zip, f.zip) AS zip,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.status, f.status) AS status,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.own_lease, f.own_lease) AS own_lease,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.doors, f.doors) AS doors,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.acres, f.acres) AS acres,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.price, f.price) AS price,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.cost_per_door, f.cost_per_door) AS cost_per_door,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.estimated_monthly_depreciation_per_rent, f.estimated_monthly_depreciation_per_rent) AS estimated_monthly_depreciation_per_rent,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.startup_investment, f.startup_investment) AS startup_investment,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.adj_cost_per_door, f.adj_cost_per_door) AS adj_cost_per_door,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.acquisition_date, f.acquisition_date) AS acquisition_date,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.activation_date, f.activation_date) AS activation_date,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.deactivation_date, f.deactivation_date) AS deactivation_date,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.notes, f.notes) AS notes
Â  FROM month_scaffold m
Â  -- Join with records that were inserted before or on the month_start
Â  LEFT JOIN cleaned_data b ON m.property = b.property AND b.insrt_ts <= m.month_start
Â  -- Fallback to first_record if no data exists before month_start
Â  LEFT JOIN first_record f ON m.property = f.property AND m.month_start < f.insrt_ts
),

-- CTE 6: RANKED
-- For each property-month combination, rank records by insert timestamp (latest first)
-- Actions: Ensures we get the most recent data state for each month
ranked AS (
Â  SELECT *,
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â ROW_NUMBER() OVER (
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â PARTITION BY property, month_startÂ 
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â ORDER BY insrt_ts DESC
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â ) AS row_rank
Â  FROM joined
),

-- CTE 7: LAST_DOORS_ACRES_CHANGE (NEW BACKFILL LOGIC)
-- Identifies the most recent month where doors OR acres actually changed
-- Actions: Find the last month with real capacity changes (not just record updates)
last_doors_acres_change AS (
Â  SELECTÂ 
Â  Â  property,
Â  Â  MAX(month_start) AS last_change_month
Â  FROM (
Â  Â  SELECTÂ 
Â  Â  Â  property,
Â  Â  Â  month_start,
Â  Â  Â  doors,
Â  Â  Â  acres,
Â  Â  Â  -- Check if doors or acres changed from previous month
Â  Â  Â  CASEÂ 
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHEN doors != COALESCE(LAG(doors) OVER (PARTITION BY property ORDER BY month_start), 0)
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  OR acres != COALESCE(LAG(acres) OVER (PARTITION BY property ORDER BY month_start), 0)
Â  Â  Â  Â  THEN 1Â 
Â  Â  Â  Â  ELSE 0Â 
Â  Â  Â  END AS has_change
Â  Â  FROM ranked
Â  Â  WHERE row_rank = 1 Â -- Only use the latest record for each month
Â  ) changes
Â  WHERE has_change = 1 Â -- Only months with actual capacity changes
Â  GROUP BY property
),

-- CTE 8: CURRENT_ACQUISITION_METHOD (NEW BACKFILL LOGIC)
-- Gets the most recent acquisition method for each property (latest insert timestamp)
-- Actions: Extract the current acquisition method to use for backfill
current_acquisition_method AS (
Â  SELECTÂ 
Â  Â  property,
Â  Â  latest_acq_method
Â  FROM (
Â  Â  SELECTÂ 
Â  Â  Â  property,
Â  Â  Â  acq_method AS latest_acq_method,
Â  Â  Â  ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY property ORDER BY insrt_ts DESC) AS rn
Â  Â  FROM ranked
Â  Â  WHERE row_rank = 1 Â -- Only the latest record for each month
Â  ) sub
Â  WHERE sub.rn = 1 Â -- Only the most recent acquisition method per property
),

-- CTE 9: FINAL_DATA_WITH_BACKFILL (NEW BACKFILL LOGIC)
-- Applies the acquisition method backfill logic and calculates month-over-month differences
-- Actions: Use latest acquisition method from last capacity change month onward
final_data_with_backfill AS (
Â  SELECTÂ 
Â  Â  r.*,
Â  Â  lc.last_change_month,
Â  Â  cam.latest_acq_method,
Â  Â Â 
Â  Â  -- CORE BACKFILL LOGIC: Apply latest acquisition method from last change month forward
Â  Â  CASEÂ 
Â  Â  Â  WHEN r.month_start >= COALESCE(lc.last_change_month, r.month_start)
Â  Â  Â  THEN cam.latest_acq_method Â -- Use current acquisition method
Â  Â  Â  ELSE r.acq_method Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  -- Keep historical acquisition method
Â  Â  END AS final_acq_method,
Â  Â Â 
Â  Â  -- Calculate month-over-month differences for capacity metrics
Â  Â  COALESCE(r.doors - LAG(r.doors) OVER (PARTITION BY r.property ORDER BY r.month_start), r.doors) AS doors_mom_diff,
Â  Â  COALESCE(r.acres - LAG(r.acres) OVER (PARTITION BY r.property ORDER BY r.month_start), r.acres) AS acres_mom_diff
Â  FROM ranked r
Â  LEFT JOIN last_doors_acres_change lc ON r.property = lc.property
Â  LEFT JOIN current_acquisition_method cam ON r.property = cam.property
Â  WHERE r.row_rank = 1 Â -- Only the most recent record for each property-month
),

-- CTE 10: LATEST_STATUS
-- Gets the most current status for each property (latest insert timestamp across all data)
-- Actions: Used for displaying current property attributes in final output
latest_status AS (
Â  SELECT *
Â  FROM cleaned_data
Â  WHERE insrt_ts = (SELECT MAX(insrt_ts) FROM cleaned_data)
)

-- ========================================================================
-- FINAL QUERY: UNION OF ACTIVATION AND DEACTIVATION EVENTS WITH BACKFILL
-- ========================================================================
-- Returns monthly data for property DH596 during activation and deactivationÂ 
-- periods, using the backfilled acquisition method that aligns with actual
-- capacity changes rather than just record update timestamps.
-- ========================================================================

-- PART 1: ACTIVATION EVENTS
-- Shows monthly timeline during property activation periods with backfilled acquisition methods
SELECTÂ 
Â  f.month_start, Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â -- Monthly reporting period
Â  s.property, Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  -- Composite property identifier
Â  s.prop_id, Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â -- Property ID (filtered to DH596)
Â  s.sc_id,Â 
Â  f.final_acq_method AS acq_method, -- *** KEY CHANGE: Uses backfilled acquisition method ***
Â  s.expansion_type,Â 
Â  s.deal_type,Â 
Â  s.brand,Â 
Â  s.property_name,Â 
Â  s.address,Â 
Â  s.city,Â 
Â  s.st,
Â  s.zip,Â 
Â  s.status,Â 
Â  s.own_lease,Â 
Â  f.doors, Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â -- Historical doors count for this month
Â  f.acres, Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â -- Historical acres count for this month
Â  s.price,Â 
Â  s.cost_per_door,Â 
Â  s.estimated_monthly_depreciation_per_rent,Â 
Â  s.startup_investment,Â 
Â  s.adj_cost_per_door,Â 
Â  s.acquisition_date,Â 
Â  'Activation' AS date_type, Â  Â  Â  Â -- Event type identifier
Â  a.dates, Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â -- Activation date
Â  s.notes,
Â  f.doors_mom_diff, Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  -- Month-over-month change in doors
Â  f.acres_mom_diff Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â -- Month-over-month change in acres
FROM final_data_with_backfill f Â  Â  -- *** Main data source with backfilled acquisition methods ***
JOIN (
Â  -- Subquery to get maximum activation date for each property
Â  SELECT property, MAX(activation_date) AS dates
Â  FROM final_data_with_backfill
Â  WHERE activation_date <> '' Â  Â  Â  -- Has an activation date
Â  AND activation_date <= LAST_DAY(TRUNC(NOW(), 'YEAR') + INTERVAL 11 MONTH) -- Within current year
Â  GROUP BY property
) a ON f.property = a.property
JOIN latest_status s ON f.property = s.property Â -- Get current property details
WHERE f.activation_date <> '' Â  Â  Â  -- Only months with activation dates
Â Â 
UNION ALL

-- PART 2: DEACTIVATION EVENTS
-- Shows monthly timeline during property deactivation periods with backfilled acquisition methods
SELECTÂ 
Â  f.month_start, Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  -- Monthly reporting period
Â  s.property, Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â -- Composite property identifier
Â  s.prop_id, Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  -- Property ID (filtered to DH596)
Â  s.sc_id,Â 
Â  f.final_acq_method AS acq_method, Â  Â -- *** KEY CHANGE: Uses backfilled acquisition method ***
Â  s.expansion_type,Â 
Â  s.deal_type,Â 
Â  s.brand,Â 
Â  s.property_name,Â 
Â  s.address,Â 
Â  s.city,Â 
Â  s.st,
Â  s.zip,Â 
Â  s.status,Â 
Â  s.own_lease,Â 
Â  f.doors, Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  -- Historical doors count for this month
Â  f.acres, Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  -- Historical acres count for this month
Â  s.price,Â 
Â  s.cost_per_door,Â 
Â  s.estimated_monthly_depreciation_per_rent,Â 
Â  s.startup_investment,Â 
Â  s.adj_cost_per_door,Â 
Â  s.acquisition_date,Â 
Â  'De-Activation' AS date_type, Â  Â  Â  Â -- Event type identifier
Â  d.dates, Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  -- Deactivation date
Â  s.notes,
Â  f.doors_mom_diff, Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â -- Month-over-month change in doors
Â  f.acres_mom_diff Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  -- Month-over-month change in acres
FROM final_data_with_backfill f Â  Â  Â  Â -- *** Main data source with backfilled acquisition methods ***
JOIN (
Â  -- Subquery to get maximum deactivation date for each property
Â  SELECT property, MAX(deactivation_date) AS dates
Â  FROM final_data_with_backfill
Â  WHERE deactivation_date NOT IN ('none', '2200-12-31') -- Exclude placeholder deactivation dates
Â  GROUP BY property
) d ON f.property = d.property
JOIN latest_status s ON f.property = s.property -- Get current property details
WHERE f.deactivation_date NOT IN ('none', '2200-12-31') -- Only months with real deactivation dates


-- ========================================================================
-- QUERY SUMMARY:
-- 1. Creates monthly time series for each property
-- 2. Identifies last month where doors/acres actually changed
-- 3. Backfills latest acquisition method from that change point forward
-- 4. Returns activation and deactivation events with proper acquisition method attribution
-- 5. Includes month-over-month capacity changes for trend analysis
-- ========================================================================;;;

column1: New Metrics in Geotab Accountability Report
column29:
A. Create a new tab on the Geotab accountability Tableau titled â€œRulesetsâ€
 # 
 ## Reason: we have drivers using incorrect rulesets (some intentionally, some not intentionally) and it is leading to HOS violations.
 ## View: List all non-termed drivers codes, truck#, terminal, fleet leader, driver leader, LOB, CC, current ruleset on drivers log (or in their user profile), and if possible- list the last time their ruleset was changed (either in date, or # of days or something)
 ## I donâ€™t think we need to add a metric on the main dashboard tab for this, will just be a standalone tab

 # Filters on the report should be all the filters that we have on the â€œPersonal Conveyanceâ€ tab, but then also a filter by â€œHOS Rulesetâ€ type
 # While I donâ€™t think thereâ€™s a way to have any type of graph visual, would be good to still have a â€œgroup byâ€ selection table possible.

Â 

B. Create a new tab on the Geotab accountability Tableau titled â€œPermissionsâ€
 # 
 ## List all non-termed drivers, truck#, terminal, fleet leader, driver leader, LOB, CC, and then a column for each of the 3 special duty status permissions in their user profile (PC, YM, and Adverse Driving) and either â€œYâ€ if the permission is enable, or â€œNâ€ if it is disabled, to allow us/operations to see what a driver has turned on or off (and track trends of drivers we have removed the permissions from)
 ## Main reason here being this information is NOT available anywhere on the UI- but according to Geotab, it is available via API.

 # We used to have a screen in AS400 (for zonar) where users could go to see if a driver had permissions turned on for these/could turn them off, but we no longer have that, so no one except for Geotab â€œadminsâ€ can see this data anymore.

Â *++*Â

column1: Tablet and Geotab Device History Reporting
column29:
As a fleet operations manager, Lawrence want a unified report that connects drivers, trucks, tablets (by IMEI), and Geotab Go9 devices. This will provide a complete historical view of all hardware assigned to a truck unit, enabling us to efficiently troubleshoot recurring hardware issues, analyze trends, and manage our device inventory for planned upgrades (like the "Tab 2" phase-out). Â  MEETING NOTES: The meeting's goal was to integrate tablet *IMEI* data with *Geotab* truck and driver data in the data warehouse. The business stakeholder, Lawrence Lovelady, outlined a need for a unified view to track all devices (tablets, Go9 units) associated with a specific truck. This will help troubleshoot faulty hardware and manage device inventory. The team agreed on a BI-led approach, where the BI team will first prototype the desired reports in Alteryx before the ETL team builds the final production tables and views. ---- h2. Business Requirements & Use Cases Lawrence outlined the core business drivers for this request: # *Unified Device History:* The ultimate goal is to create a report or database that provides a complete history of all devices assigned to a single truck unit. This includes: ** The tablet, identified by its {*}IMEI number{*}. ** The Geotab unit, identified by its {*}Go9 device ID{*}. # *Troubleshooting & Trend Analysis:* ** Identify if a specific tablet or Go9 device is consistently causing issues across different drivers or trucks. ** Determine if a driver's reported issues are related to a specific piece of hardware by viewing their login history across multiple tablets. # *Inventory Management:* ** Efficiently identify all trucks that are still equipped with older "Tab 2" models to schedule them for upgrades. ---- h2. Key Decisions & Technical Plan The team made several key decisions on how to structure the data and the project workflow. h3. Data & Reporting Structure Two primary data outputs were identified: * *Active Status Report:* A "current state" view that shows the *latest* driver login for each tablet, linking the driver, IMEI, and the truck they are assigned to in Geotab. * *Device History Table:* A comprehensive historical log, organized by {*}truck unit{*}, that shows every device (tablet or Go9) that has ever been associated with that truck. h3. 1Development Process The project will proceed in the following order: # *BI Prototyping (Lead: BI Analyst):* The BI team will take the lead. They will use a tool like *Alteryx* to connect to the raw data sources and build a working prototype of the reports. This allows for flexible and rapid validation with the business before any permanent data structures are built. # *ETL Development (Lead: Rick):* Once the BI prototype is approved by Lawrence, the finalized logic and data mappings will be handed off to the ETL team. Rick will then build the robust, production-level SQL tables, views, and data pipelines in the data warehouse. ---- h2. Action Plan ğŸ“‹ |Owner|Action Item|Deadline| |*Narissa (PM)*|1. Assign a BI Analyst ("Ty" or another resource) to the project.
2. Provide the meeting recording and this summary to the analyst.
3. Schedule a follow-up meeting once the analyst has reviewed the materials.|EOD, Sep 3, 2025| |*Lawrence (Business)*|Create a simple *Excel spreadsheet* to serve as a template for the final report. This will clarify the required columns and format for the BI team.|Sep 5, 2025| |*Assigned BI Analyst*|1. Review the project materials.
2. Connect with Rick to get access to the necessary data tables/views.
3. Begin building the report prototype in Alteryx based on Lawrence's spreadsheet.|TBD| |*Rick (ETL)*|1. Create a *SQL view* on top of the {{geotab_hos_accountability_stg}} table to provide the BI team with easy access for prototyping.
2. Await the finalized requirements and logic from the BI team before starting production ETL work.| Â  Â  ||{color:#172b4d}*Discovery Checklist*{color}|Â | |*Status*|*Criteria to move to next status*| |Ready| * -Description required fields completed- * -Business owner identified-| |Define| * -Quantitative value statements/KPIs added- * -Affected departments/stakeholders needed to write high-level requirements identified. (Tableau Report Champions needed if position user count > 20)-| |Share| * Report idea presented to BI Team * Alternate solutions and recommended approach if applicable. * Consensus to move forward to Report * Priority in Report list set| |Schedule| * Project scheduled in roadmap.| |Design| * Create Data Source * Design Tableau Report * Time and Cost Estimate| |Approve| * User Testing * Report Approved * Training plan established| |Done| * Report Published| |Track| * 30/60/90 Report Tracking Review Subtasks. * Review current results on report vs business owners intake established goal. ** Report Usage ** Metric Goals and KPI success (Compared to the original intake goal.)| ||{color:#172b4d}*RICE Scoring* {color}|Description|Response| |{*}R{*}each{color:#de350b}*{color}|_{color:#de350b}*{color}_|Â | |{*}I{*}mpact{color:#de350b}*{color}|_{color:#de350b}*{color}_|Â | |{*}C{*}onfidence|__|Â | |{*}E{*}ffort|_Developer Efforts: 1 person 3 weeks = 120 hours_|Â | |*RICE* score|(Reach x Impact x Confidence) / Effort|Â | ||*{color:#172b4d}Information for Development Team{color}*|| |*Brief description of report needed{color:#de350b}*{color}*| |The business needs a unified report that connects a *truck* to all its associated hardware: the *tablet* (via IMEI number) and the {*}Geotab Go9 device{*}. The report must also show the *driver* currently or historically logged into that tablet. The request includes two main views: # *Active Status View:* Shows the _latest_ login data, answering "Who is using what tablet in what truck right now?" # *Historical View:* A complete log of every device ever associated with a truck unit to enable trend analysis.| |*Quantitative value statements/KPIs* *{color:#de350b}*{color}*| |What is the key strategic business goal/initiative/purpose of the report?Â  To improve operational efficiency by proactively identifying and managing faulty fleet hardware (tablets and Geotab units) and streamlining device inventory for upgrades.| What are the business outcomes we're striving for these initiatives? * Faster diagnosis of hardware-related issues. * Reduction in unnecessary hardware swaps by the shop. * A streamlined process for identifying trucks that require mandatory hardware upgrades (e.g., phasing out "Tab 2s"). What metrics and KPIs can help us track out progress on these business outcomes? * *Metric:* Time-to-identify a chronically failing device. *Goal:* Reduce identification time from weeks of anecdotal reports to a single day of data analysis. * *Metric:* Time required to generate a list of trucks needing upgrades. *Goal:* Reduce from hours of manual work to under 5 minutes. * *KPI:* A 15% reduction in support tickets related to "tablet issues" that are ultimately traced back to a faulty device. Who will be using the report? * Primary users: *Fleet Operations Managers* (like Lawrence). * Secondary users: *Shop/Maintenance Leads* who perform the hardware swaps. Current tools utilized. AS400 screen options, AS400 reporting and/or any other reports. The current process is entirely {*}manual{*}. It involves pulling raw log data from {*}Elastic{*}, pasting it into {*}Microsoft Excel{*}, and manually cleaning and cross-referencing the information. There is no existing automated report.

column172:
15/Aug/25 11:40 AM;Katey_harris@swifttrans.com;--Successful Freightbox Scans
SELECTÂ 
Â  SPLIT_PART(loads_0_load_id, '|', 1) AS Ordr_nbr,Â 
Â  COUNT(DISTINCT CASE WHEN trailer_association_type='Attach' THEN trailer_trailerid ELSE NULL END) as attach_count,
Â  COUNT(DISTINCT CASE WHEN trailer_association_type='Detach' THEN trailer_trailerid ELSE NULL END) as detach_count,
Â  'Y' as FBX_FLAG
FROM multi_prod_hst.fbx_association_hst
WHERE DRIVER_EVENT_BILL_TO_TYPE = 'Logistics'
GROUP BY SPLIT_PART(loads_0_load_id, '|', 1);;;
column173:
15/Aug/25 11:40 AM;Katey_harris@swifttrans.com;/*
==================================================================
McLeod Orders Query - Comprehensive Order Data Extract
==================================================================
Description: This query extracts comprehensive order information from McLeod TMS,
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  including order details, locations, carrier information, financial data,
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  and various operational metrics for Swift and Knight operations.

Author: Analytics Team
Date: 2024
Purpose: Data extraction for Freightbox reporting and analysis
==================================================================
*/

SELECT DISTINCT
Â  Â  -- System Information
Â  Â  CURRENT_TIMESTAMP AS last_refresh,
Â  Â  'McLeod' AS 'TMS',
Â  Â 
Â  Â  -- Order Identification
Â  Â  o.id AS 'Order#',
Â  Â  CASE
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHEN[Dispatch Date]> ds.[actual_departure]
Â  Â  Â  Â  THEN os.sched_arrive_early
Â  Â  Â  Â  ELSE[Dispatch Date]
Â  Â  END AS 'Dispatch Date',
Â  Â  blnum AS 'BOL#',
Â  Â  consignee_refno AS 'Ref#',
Â  Â 
Â  Â  -- Company Classification
Â  Â  CASE
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHEN LEFT(o.seg_alloc_code,2) = 'SW' THEN 'Swift'
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHEN LEFT(o.seg_alloc_code,2) = 'KN' THEN 'Knight'
Â  Â  Â  Â  ELSE'Other'
Â  Â  END AS 'Company',
Â  Â 
Â  Â  -- Customer Information
Â  Â  COALESCE(RTRIM(l.id), RTRIM(o.customer_id)) AS 'Ctrl Party ID',
Â  Â  COALESCE(l.name, cst.[name]) AS 'Ctrl Party',
Â  Â  RTRIM(o.customer_id) AS 'Cust ID',
Â  Â  cst.[name] AS 'Cust Name',
Â  Â  o.[status] AS 'Status',
Â  Â 
Â  Â  -- Equipment Information
Â  Â  TRIM(o.equipment_type_id) AS 'Equip',
Â  Â  e.exchange_type AS 'Equip Type',
Â  Â  CASE
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHEN e.exchange_type IN ('R') THEN 'REF'
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHEN e.exchange_type IN ('F') THEN 'FLAT'
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHEN e.exchange_type IN ('V') THEN 'DRY'
Â  Â  Â  Â  ELSE 'Other'
Â  Â  END AS 'Equip Parent',
Â  Â  e.descr AS 'Equip Name',
Â  Â 
Â  Â  -- Line of Business Classification
Â  Â  CASE
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHEN TRIM(o.seg_alloc_code) = 'KN3PL' OR o.equipment_type_id = 'LTL' THEN '3PL'
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHEN TRIM(o.equipment_type_id) IN ('SPO','KPO') THEN 'PO'
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHEN o.seg_alloc_code IN ('KNPRT','SWPRT') THEN 'PORT'
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHEN e.exchange_type IN ('R') THEN 'RFR'
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHEN e.exchange_type IN ('F') OR o.equipment_type_id IN ('F') THEN 'FLAT'
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHENLEFT(o.seg_alloc_code,2) ='KN'THEN
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  CASE
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  WHEN e.exchange_type NOT IN ('F','R','V') THEN
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  CASE
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  WHEN o.customer_id IN ('REFRIG','KOLD','KOOLT') THEN'RFR'
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  ELSE'DRY'
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  END
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  ELSE'DRY'
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  END
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHEN LEFT(o.seg_alloc_code,2) = 'SW' THEN
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  CASE
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  WHEN e.exchange_type IN ('V') THEN 'DRY'
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  ELSE'Other'
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  END Â 
Â  Â  Â  Â  ELSE'Other'
Â  Â  END AS LOB,
Â  Â 
Â  Â  -- Origin Location Information
Â  Â  pl.location_id AS 'Initial Pickup ID',
Â  Â  pl.location_name AS 'Initial Pickup Name',
Â  Â  os.location_id AS 'Origin ID',
Â  Â  os.location_name AS 'Origin Name',
Â  Â  TRIM(os.city_name) AS 'Origin City',
Â  Â  os.[state] AS 'Origin State',
Â  Â  os.zip_code AS 'Origin Zip',
Â  Â  oz.zone_id AS 'Origin Zone',
Â  Â  os.latitude AS 'Origin Lat',
Â  Â  os.longitude AS 'Origin Lon',
Â  Â  REPLACE(oz.market_area_id,'-','_') AS 'oKMA',
Â  Â 
Â  Â  -- Origin Timing
Â  Â  os.sched_arrive_early AS 'Pickup Early',
Â  Â  COALESCE(os.sched_arrive_late, os.sched_arrive_early) AS 'Pickup Late',
Â  Â  os.[actual_arrival] AS 'Origin Arrive',
Â  Â  os.[actual_departure] AS 'Origin Depart',
Â  Â  shipper_stop_id AS 'Origin Stop',
Â  Â 
Â  Â  -- Destination Location Information
Â  Â  ds.location_id AS 'Destin ID',
Â  Â  ds.location_name AS 'Destin Name',
Â  Â  TRIM(ds.city_name) AS 'Destin City',
Â  Â  ds.[state] AS 'Destin State',
Â  Â  ds.zip_code AS 'Destin Zip',
Â  Â  dz.zone_id AS 'Destin Zone',
Â  Â  ds.latitude AS 'Destin Lat',
Â  Â  ds.longitude AS 'Destin Lon',
Â  Â  REPLACE(dz.market_area_id,'-','_') AS 'dKMA',
Â  Â 
Â  Â  -- Destination Timing
Â  Â  ds.sched_arrive_early AS 'Delivery Early',
Â  Â  COALESCE(ds.sched_arrive_late, ds.sched_arrive_early) AS 'Delivery Late',
Â  Â  ds.[actual_arrival] AS 'Destin Arrive',
Â  Â  ds.[actual_departure] AS 'Destin Depart',
Â  Â  consignee_stop_id AS 'Destin Stop',
Â  Â 
Â  Â  -- Key Dates
Â  Â  os.sched_arrive_early AS 'Ship Date',
Â  Â  ds.[actual_departure] AS 'Empty Date',
Â  Â  DATEPART(ww, ds.[actual_departure]) AS 'Empty Week',

Â  Â 
Â  Â  -- Carrier and Equipment Information
Â  Â  im.[Carrier Code],
Â  Â  carpy.name AS 'Carrier',
Â  Â  carp.[icc_number] AS 'Carrier ICC',
Â  Â  carp.[dot_number] AS 'Carrier DOT',
Â  Â  carp.safety_rating AS 'Safety Rating',
Â  Â  im.[Driver ID],
Â  Â  im.[Driver Name],
Â  Â  im.[Driver Phone],
Â  Â  im.[Trailer#],
Â  Â  im.[Truck#],

Â  Â  -- Financial Information
Â  Â  CASE
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHEN mrp.[Manifest Rev Pct]>0
Â  Â  Â  Â  THENISNULL(m.[Carrier Linehaul],0) * mrp.[Manifest Rev Pct]
Â  Â  Â  Â  ELSE ISNULL(m.[Carrier Linehaul],0)
Â  Â  END AS 'Carrier Linehaul',
Â  Â  ISNULL(carep.[Carrier Extra Pay],0) AS 'Carrier Extra Pay',
Â  Â  CASE
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHEN mrp.[Manifest Rev Pct]>0
Â  Â  Â  Â  THENISNULL(m.[Carrier Linehaul],0) * mrp.[Manifest Rev Pct]
Â  Â  Â  Â  ELSE ISNULL(m.[Carrier Linehaul],0)
Â  Â  END + ISNULL(carep.[Carrier Extra Pay],0) AS 'Total Carrier Pay',
Â  Â  ISNULL(total_charge,0) AS 'Revenue',
Â  Â  ISNULL(freight_charge,0) AS 'Linehaul Rate',
Â  Â  ISNULL(fsc.fsc, 0) AS 'Fuel Surcharge',
Â  Â  ISNULL(otherchargetotal,0) AS 'Other Charges',

Â  Â  -- Distance and Stop Information
Â  Â  ISNULL(m.[Order Miles],0) AS 'Order Miles',
Â  Â  stpc.StopCount AS 'Stop Count',
Â  Â 
Â  Â  -- Operations Information
Â  Â  im.[Buyer ID],
Â  Â  im.[operations_user],
Â  Â  brk.name AS 'Buyer',
Â  Â  [priority_status_id] AS 'Priority Status',
Â  Â  CASE
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHEN o.[priority_status_id] IN ('FAIL 1','FAIL1X','FAIL2X','FAIL3X','SPOTFL','CRFAIL','CARFAIL','SPOTFAIL','GRENFAIL')
Â  Â  Â  Â  THEN'Fail'
Â  Â  Â  Â  ELSE''
Â  Â  END AS 'Service Fail',
Â  Â  o.operations_user AS 'AM ID',
Â  Â  am.name AS 'AM',
Â  Â  ordered_date AS 'Entered Date',
Â  Â  entered_user_id AS 'Entered By ID',
Â  Â  cmt.id AS 'Commitment',
Â  Â  commodity_id AS 'CMD Code',
Â  Â  commodity AS 'CMD Name',
Â  Â 
Â  Â  -- Boolean Flags and Classifications Â 
Â  Â  CASE WHEN ac.car_id IS NOT NULL THEN 1 ELSE 0 END AS isAssetCarried,
Â  Â  CASE WHEN o.[teams_required] IN ('Y') THEN 1 ELSE 0 END AS 'isTeamLoad',
Â  Â  CASE
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHEN os.city_name = ds.city_name
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND os.state = ds.state
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND o.billing_loaded_distance >200
Â  Â  Â  Â  THEN1ELSE0
Â  Â  END AS isRoundTrip,
Â  Â 
Â  Â  -- Company-Specific Order References
Â  Â  CASE WHEN LEFT(o.seg_alloc_code,2) = 'KN' THEN consignee_refno END AS 'Knight Order',
Â  Â  CASE WHEN LEFT(o.seg_alloc_code,2) = 'SW' THEN consignee_refno END AS 'Swift Order',
Â  Â 
Â  Â  -- Trailer Attach/Detach Indicators
Â  Â  CASE
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHENLEN([inbound_empty]) >4
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND[inbound_empty]NOTLIKE'%bob%'
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND[inbound_empty]NOTLIKE'%live'
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND[inbound_empty]NOTLIKE'%asset%'
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND[inbound_empty]NOTLIKE'%tonu%'
Â  Â  Â  Â  THEN1ELSE0
Â  Â  END AS inboundAttach,
Â  Â  CASE
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHENLEN([inbound_empty]) >4
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND[inbound_empty]NOTLIKE'%bob%'
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND[inbound_empty]NOTLIKE'%live%'
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND[inbound_empty]NOTLIKE'%asset%'
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND [inbound_empty] NOT LIKE '%tonu%'
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND ([inbound_empty] IS NULL OR [inbound_empty] != im.[Trailer#])
Â  Â  Â  Â  THEN1ELSE0
Â  Â  END AS inboundDetach,
Â  Â  CASE
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHENLEN(im.[Trailer#]) >4
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND im.[Trailer#]NOTLIKE'%bob%'
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND im.[Trailer#]NOTLIKE'%live%'
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND im.[Trailer#]NOTLIKE'%tonu%'
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND ([inbound_empty] IS NULL OR [inbound_empty] != im.[Trailer#])
Â  Â  Â  Â  THEN1ELSE0
Â  Â  END AS loadedAttach,
Â  Â  CASE
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHENLEN(im.[Trailer#]) >4
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND im.[Trailer#]NOTLIKE'%bob%'
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND im.[Trailer#]NOTLIKE'%live%'
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND im.[Trailer#]NOTLIKE'%tonu%'
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND ([outbound_empty] IS NULL OR [outbound_empty] != im.[Trailer#])
Â  Â  Â  Â  THEN1ELSE0
Â  Â  END AS loadedDetach,
Â  Â  CASE
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHENLEN([outbound_empty]) >4
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND[outbound_empty]NOTLIKE'%bob%'
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND[outbound_empty]NOTLIKE'%live%'
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND[outbound_empty]NOTLIKE'%tonu%'
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND[outbound_empty]NOTLIKE'%asset%'
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND ([outbound_empty] IS NULL OR [outbound_empty] != im.[Trailer#])
Â  Â  Â  Â  THEN1ELSE0
Â  Â  END AS outboundAttach,
Â  Â  CASE
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHENLEN([outbound_empty]) >4
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND[outbound_empty]NOTLIKE'%bob%'
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND[outbound_empty]NOTLIKE'%live%'
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND[outbound_empty]NOTLIKE'%tonu%'
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND[outbound_empty]NOTLIKE'%asset%'
Â  Â  Â  Â  THEN1ELSE0
Â  Â  END AS outboundDetach,
Â  Â 
Â  Â  -- Trailer Information
Â  Â  [inbound_empty] AS 'Inbound Empty',
Â  Â  [trailer_status] AS 'Trailer Status',
Â  Â  o.[trl_return_date] AS 'Trailer Return Date',
Â  Â  [pickup_empty_loc] AS 'Pickup Empty Location',
Â  Â  o.[return_date] AS 'Return Date',
Â  Â  [return_empty_loc] AS 'Return Empty Location',
Â  Â  [outbound_empty] AS 'Outbound Empty',
Â  Â  [trailer_return] AS 'Trailer Return',
Â  Â 
Â  Â  -- Order Status Flags
Â  Â  conf.is_confirmed,
Â  Â  'Y' AS is_billto,
Â  Â  brokerage_status,
Â  Â  CASE
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHEN (TRIM(o.customer_id) IN ('PONRKN','PONRSL','818358SW','NOREV','NPPOKN','NPPOSL','NRTLKN','NRTLSL')
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  OR TRIM(l.id) IN ('PONRKN','PONRSL','818358SW','NOREV','NPPOKN','NPPOSL','NRTLKN','NRTLSL'))
Â  Â  Â  Â  THEN1ELSE0
Â  Â  END AS NoRev,
Â  Â  im.planned_manifest_id,
Â  Â  order_type_id AS 'Order Type'
FROM [lme].[dbo].[orders](nolock) o
Â  Â  -- Core Reference Tables
Â  Â  LEFT JOIN [lme].[dbo].[equipment_type](nolock) e
Â  Â  Â  Â  ON o.equipment_type_id = e.id
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND e.[company_id] = 'TMS'
Â  Â  LEFT JOIN [lme].[dbo].[customer](nolock) cst
Â  Â  Â  Â  ON cst.id = o.customer_id
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND cst.[company_id] = 'TMS'
Â  Â  LEFT JOIN [lme].[dbo].[users](nolock) am
Â  Â  Â  Â  ON am.id = o.operations_user
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND am.[company_id] = 'TMS'
Â  Â  LEFT JOIN [lme].[dbo].[location](nolock) l
Â  Â  Â  Â  ON l.id = o.ctrl_party_id
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND l.[company_id] = 'TMS'
Â  Â 
Â  Â  -- Stop Information
Â  Â  LEFT JOIN [lme].[dbo].[stop](nolock) os
Â  Â  Â  Â  ON os.id = o.shipper_stop_id
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND os.[company_id] = 'TMS'
Â  Â  LEFT JOIN [lme].[dbo].[stop](nolock) ds
Â  Â  Â  Â  ON ds.id = o.consignee_stop_id
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND ds.[company_id] = 'TMS'
Â  Â 
Â  Â  -- Geographic Zone Information
Â  Â  LEFT JOIN [lme].[dbo].[zipzone](nolock) oz
Â  Â  Â  Â  ON LEFT(os.zip_code,3) = oz.zipcode
Â  Â  Â  Â  ANDLEN(oz.zone_id) =2
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND oz.[company_id] = 'TMS'
Â  Â  LEFT JOIN [lme].[dbo].[zipzone](nolock) dz
Â  Â  Â  Â  ON LEFT(ds.zip_code,3) = dz.zipcode
Â  Â  Â  Â  ANDLEN(dz.zone_id) =2
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND dz.[company_id] = 'TMS'
Â  Â 
Â  Â  -- Movement and Carrier Information Subquery
Â  Â  -- Extracts initial movement data, carrier details, and equipment assignments
Â  Â  LEFT JOIN (
Â  Â  Â  Â  SELECT
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  mo.order_id,
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  m.id AS 'Initial Move#',
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  m.[override_payee_id] AS 'Carrier Code',
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  m.[override_driver_id] AS 'Driver ID',
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  m.[override_driver_nm] AS 'Driver Name',
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  m.[override_drvr_cell] AS 'Driver Phone',
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  m.[carrier_trailer] AS 'Trailer#',
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  m.[carrier_tractor] AS 'Truck#',
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  m.[dispatcher_user_id] AS 'Buyer ID',
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  m.[operations_user],
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  m.brokerage_status,
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  mo.planned_manifest_id
Â  Â  Â  Â  FROM [lme].[dbo].[movement_order](nolock) mo
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  LEFT JOIN [lme].[dbo].[movement](nolock) m
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  ON m.id = mo.movement_id Â 
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  AND m.[company_id] = 'TMS'
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  JOIN [lme].[dbo].[orders](nolock) o
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  ON o.id = mo.order_id
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  AND o.shipper_stop_id = m.origin_stop_id
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  AND o.[company_id] = 'TMS'
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHERE mo.[company_id] = 'TMS'
Â  Â  ) im ON im.order_id = o.id
Â  Â 
Â  Â  -- Carrier Payment and Distance Aggregation Subquery
Â  Â  -- Sums up carrier linehaul pay and total order miles across all movements
Â  Â  LEFT JOIN (
Â  Â  Â  Â  SELECT
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  mo.order_id,
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  SUM(ISNULL(m.[override_pay_amt],0)) AS 'Carrier Linehaul',
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  SUM(ISNULL(m.move_distance,0)) AS 'Order Miles'
Â  Â  Â  Â  FROM [lme].[dbo].[movement_order](nolock) mo
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  LEFT JOIN [lme].[dbo].[movement](nolock) m
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  ON m.id = mo.movement_id
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  AND m.[company_id] = 'TMS'
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHERE mo.[company_id] = 'TMS'
Â  Â  Â  Â  GROUP BY order_id
Â  Â  ) m ON m.order_id = o.id
Â  Â 
Â  Â  -- Additional Reference Tables
Â  Â  LEFT JOIN [lme].[dbo].[drs_payee](nolock) carp
Â  Â  Â  Â  ON carp.id = im.[Carrier Code]
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND carp.[company_id] = 'TMS'
Â  Â  LEFT JOIN [lme].[dbo].[payee](nolock) carpy
Â  Â  Â  Â  ON carpy.id = im.[Carrier Code]
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND carpy.[company_id] = 'TMS'
Â  Â  LEFT JOIN [lme].[dbo].[commitment_history](nolock) cmt
Â  Â  Â  Â  ON cmt.order_id = o.id
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND cmt.[company_id] = 'TMS'
Â  Â  LEFT JOIN [lme].[dbo].[users](nolock) brk
Â  Â  Â  Â  ON brk.id = im.[Buyer ID]
Â  Â  Â  Â  AND brk.[company_id] = 'TMS'
Â  Â 
Â  Â  -- Dispatch Date Determination Subquery
Â  Â  -- Complex logic to determine proper dispatch date based on order type and business rules
Â  Â  -- Different order types use different brokerage status changes to mark dispatch
Â  Â  LEFT JOIN (
Â  Â  Â  Â  SELECT
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  o.id AS order_id,
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  CASE
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  WHEN o.order_type_id IN ('SERVICE','IMPORT','EXPORT') THEN dspintl.[Dispatch Date]
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  WHEN TRIM(o.seg_alloc_code) = 'KN3PL' OR o.equipment_type_id = 'LTL' THEN dsp3pl.[Dispatch Date]
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  ELSE dsp.[Dispatch Date]
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  END AS 'Dispatch Date'
Â  Â  Â  Â  FROM [lme].[dbo].[orders](nolock) o
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  -- Standard orders: Dispatch = BOOKED status
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  LEFT JOIN (
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  SELECT
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  order_id,
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  MIN(posted_date) AS'Dispatch Date'
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  FROM [lme].[dbo].[order_post_hist](nolock)
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  WHERE[company_id]='TMS'
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  AND comments = 'Brokerage status changed to BOOKED.'
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  GROUP BY order_id
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  ) dsp ON dsp.order_id = o.id
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â 
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  -- 3PL/LTL orders: Dispatch = COVERED status
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  LEFT JOIN (
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  SELECT
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  order_id,
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  MIN(posted_date) AS'Dispatch Date'
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  FROM [lme].[dbo].[order_post_hist](nolock)
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  WHERE[company_id]='TMS'
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  AND comments = 'Brokerage status changed to COVERED.'
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  GROUP BY order_id
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  ) dsp3pl ON dsp3pl.order_id = o.id
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â 
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  -- International orders: Dispatch = ENROUTE status
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  LEFT JOIN (
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  SELECT
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  order_id,
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  MIN(posted_date) AS'Dispatch Date'
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  FROM [lme].[dbo].[order_post_hist](nolock)
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  WHERE[company_id]='TMS'
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  AND comments = 'Brokerage status changed to ENROUTE.'
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  GROUP BY order_id
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  ) dspintl ON dspintl.order_id = o.id
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHERECASE
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  WHEN o.order_type_id IN ('SERVICE','IMPORT','EXPORT') THEN dspintl.[Dispatch Date]
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  WHEN TRIM(o.seg_alloc_code) = 'KN3PL' OR o.equipment_type_id = 'LTL' THEN dsp3pl.[Dispatch Date]
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  ELSE dsp.[Dispatch Date]
Â  Â  Â  Â  END IS NOT NULL
Â  Â  ) dspd ON dspd.order_id = o.id
Â  Â 
Â  Â  -- Carrier Extra Pay Subquery
Â  Â  -- Calculates additional pay/deductions for carriers (excluding base linehaul)
Â  Â  LEFT JOIN (
Â  Â  Â  Â  SELECT
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  order_id,
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  SUM(CASE
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  WHEN code_type IN ('B','D') THENISNULL(d.amount,0) *-1
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  ELSE ISNULL(d.amount,0)
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  END) AS 'Carrier Extra Pay'
Â  Â  Â  Â  FROM [lme].[dbo].[driver_extra_pay](nolock) d
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  LEFT JOIN [lme].[dbo].deduct_code(nolock) c
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  ON c.id = d.deduct_code_id
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  AND c.[company_id] = 'TMS'
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHERE d.[company_id] = 'TMS'
Â  Â  Â  Â  GROUP BY order_id
Â  Â  ) carep ON carep.order_id = o.id
Â  Â 
Â  Â  -- Initial Pickup Location Subquery
Â  Â  -- Gets the first stop (pickup location) for each order
Â  Â  LEFT JOIN (
Â  Â  Â  Â  SELECT
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  order_id,
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  location_id,
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  location_name
Â  Â  Â  Â  FROM [lme].[dbo].[stop](nolock) s
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHERE[company_id]='TMS'
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  AND order_sequence = 1
Â  Â  ) pl ON pl.order_id = o.id
Â  Â 
Â  Â  -- Stop Count Subquery
Â  Â  -- Counts total number of stops per order
Â  Â  LEFT JOIN (
Â  Â  Â  Â  SELECT
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  order_id,
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  COUNT(*) AS StopCount
Â  Â  Â  Â  FROM [lme].[dbo].[stop] (nolock)
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHERE [company_id] = 'TMS'
Â  Â  Â  Â  GROUP BY order_id
Â  Â  ) stpc ON stpc.order_id = o.id
Â  Â 
Â  Â  -- Fuel Surcharge Subquery
Â  Â  -- Aggregates fuel surcharge amounts from other charges
Â  Â  LEFT JOIN (
Â  Â  Â  Â  SELECT
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  order_id,
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  SUM(ISNULL(amount,0)) AS FSC
Â  Â  Â  Â  FROM [lme].[dbo].[other_charge](nolock)
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHERE[company_id]='TMS'
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  AND charge_id IN ('BTF','FSCF','FSCM','FSCP')
Â  Â  Â  Â  GROUP BY order_id
Â  Â  ) fsc ON fsc.order_id = o.id
Â  Â 
Â  Â  -- Order Confirmation Status Subquery
Â  Â  -- Determines if all stops are confirmed
Â  Â  LEFT JOIN (
Â  Â  Â  Â  SELECT
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  order_id,
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  CASE
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  WHEN COUNT(id) = SUM(CASE WHEN confirmed = 'Y' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END)
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  THEN1ELSE0
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  END AS is_confirmed
Â  Â  Â  Â  FROM [lme].[dbo].[stop](nolock)
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHERE [company_id] = 'TMS'
Â  Â  Â  Â  GROUP BY order_id
Â  Â  ) conf ON conf.order_id = o.id
Â  Â 
Â  Â  -- Manifest Revenue Percentage Subquery
Â  Â  -- Calculates revenue percentage for orders that are part of planned manifests
Â  Â  -- Used to adjust carrier linehaul based on manifest grouping
Â  Â  LEFT JOIN (
Â  Â  Â  Â  SELECT
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  mo.[movement_id],
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  mo.[order_id],
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  CASE
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  WHEN mr.[Manifest Revenue]>0
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  THENISNULL(o.total_charge,0) / mr.[Manifest Revenue]
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  END AS 'Manifest Rev Pct'
Â  Â  Â  Â  FROM [lme].[dbo].[movement_order](nolock) mo
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  LEFT JOIN [lme].[dbo].[orders](nolock) o
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  ON o.id = mo.order_id
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  AND o.[company_id] = 'TMS'
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  LEFT JOIN (
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  -- Calculates total manifest revenue for revenue percentage calculation
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  SELECT
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  movement_id, Â 
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  SUM(ISNULL(total_charge,0)) AS 'Manifest Revenue'
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  FROM [lme].[dbo].[movement_order](nolock) mo
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  LEFT JOIN [lme].[dbo].[orders](nolock) o
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  ON o.id = mo.order_id
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  AND o.[company_id] = 'TMS'
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  WHERE planned_manifest_id IS NOT NULL
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  AND mo.[company_id] = 'TMS'
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  GROUP BY movement_id
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  ) mr ON mr.movement_id = mo.movement_id Â 
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHERE planned_manifest_id IS NOT NULL
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  AND mo.[company_id] = 'TMS'
Â  Â  ) mrp ON mrp.order_id = o.id
Â  Â 
Â  Â  -- Asset Carriers Reference
Â  Â  -- Links to asset carrier lookup table for carrier classification
Â  Â  LEFT JOIN [Logistics_BI].[dbo].[AssetCarriers](nolock) ac
Â  Â  Â  Â  ON ac.car_id = im.[Carrier Code]

/*
==================================================================
FILTERS AND CONDITIONS
==================================================================
*/
WHERE o.[company_id] = 'TMS'
Â  Â  AND o.status != 'V' Â -- Exclude voided orders
Â  Â  AND TRIM(o.equipment_type_id) IN ('SPO','KPO','PO','PORE','POT','POFB') Â -- Power-only equipment types
Â  Â  AND o.id = '3411307' Â -- Specific order filter (likely for testing);;;

column29:
Evan and Jacob Brorson asked to be able to update the Container Pools report.Â  The first addition is to add in a Region based upon a Rail Market Outgate.Â  They will need to put that matrix together and let me know.Â  In the mean time I believe I'll need to bring in SIS data into the data source.

The second item is to bring in the tracking location of the chassis that is attached to each container.Â  This will only be good for the West and Central regions since that is the only place we have Swift privately owned chassis we can track.Â  Look into SkyBitz data.

The third item is to bring in SIS data to find the last Outgate date for each container, and then add a metric for Days Since Last Outgate.

column175: 21/Aug/25 3:48 PM;T_green@swifttrans.com;Made small tweak to the workflow to sort the last record for each container to be off of early_appt_ts unless it's '9999-12-31' then using notify_ts.Â  This will fix the 7 records that Jacob brought to my attention today that didn't make sense on the report because the outgate and notify was 5+ years prior.;;;

column1: Happy Robot - Owner Operator Warm Leads
column29:
Â  Objective: Implement an automated Happy Robot workflow to engage owner-operator warm leads once Tenstreet sets the warm-lead flag for a driver.
Â 
Â  Scope:
Â  - Trigger on Tenstreet warm-lead flag within minutes of detection.
Â  - Initiate outbound call; handle voicemail/no-answer; schedule/record follow-ups.
Â  - Provide an inbound callback prompt that routes callers back into the appropriate step.
Â  - Capture outcomes and surface basic telemetry (attempts, status, duration) for reporting.
Â 
Â  Deliverables:
Â  1) Outbound call flow, 2) Inbound callback prompt, 3) Error handling and logging, 4) Telemetry/reporting hooks.
Â 
Â  Dependencies: Tenstreet flag availability/consistency; Happy Robot webhook credentials; valid E.164 test numbers.
Â 
Â  Risks: Phone number data quality; Do-Not-Call compliance; call window timing and after-hours behavior.

column29: Develop a Happy Robot workflow to facilitate weekly wellness calls for drivers. Trainees will receive a scheduled wellness call each week, focusing on a variety of topics to support their development and overall well-being.
column126: Waiting on scripts from Tracy. Happy Robot is going to create first POC workflow.
column172: 29/Jul/25 10:11 AM;Ashley_cleavenger@swifttrans.com;Example Trainee Code# 500788;;;
column173:
29/Jul/25 10:15 AM;Ashley_cleavenger@swifttrans.com;h2. *Meeting notes 7/29*

*Inbound Call Workflow:* Aditya and Ashley discussed the creation of an inbound call workflow using the AI agent. Aditya provided an example prompt and explained the need to create five or six blocks for different weeks. They also discussed attaching the dataset to the prompt to follow through with specific questions for each week.

*Weekly Questions:* Aditya explained the different questions that would be asked each week, progressively getting more complex. He provided examples of questions for different weeks, such as submitting PTO, backing up, and safety issues.

*Previous Call Context:* Ty inquired about the context of the previous call being loaded into the next call. Aditya mentioned that they would need to ask Happy Robot about this, as it is not currently an option.

*Thursday Call Participants:* Rene asked about the participants for the Thursday call with Ken. Aditya suggested starting with Tracy and letting him pick who he wants on the team. Ty also requested to be added to the call to get more involved.

*Data Sources:* Aditya discussed the data sources for identifying trainees and their statuses. He mentioned using driver master as a read-only source and Elastic APIs to pull data. They also considered using Google Sheets or Excel files for tracking.

*API Development:* Rene and Aditya discussed the need to build an API to gather all the necessary data. Aditya suggested starting with Elastic APIs and working with Rick to ensure all data points are available. If not, they would consider building an API for the 400.

*Workflow Creation:* Ashley and Aditya worked on creating the workflow in Happy Robot. They discussed provisioning a phone number through Twilio and building out the AI agent steps. Rene suggested duplicating the existing workflow and tweaking it.

*Validation and Testing:* Aditya advised Ashley to validate the data with Rick using a trainee driver code from Tracy. They would check if the trainee flag and hours of service are correctly displayed in Elastic. If not, they would consider building an API for the 400.

*Next Steps:* Ashley summarized her next steps, which include working with Rick on data points in Elastic and starting to build out the workflow. Aditya reminded her to reach out if she has any questions or needs feedback.

*Thursday Call and Deliverables:* Aditya mentioned the items owed to Ashley, including a breakdown by week of the questions to ask and the script prompt. Rene confirmed the Thursday call at 9:30 AM.

Â 

Action Items:Â 

. *Happy Robot Workflow Data Validation:* Obtain a trainee driver code from Tracey and use it with Rick to validate that the necessary data points (is trainee flag, hours of service, driving/off duty status) are correctly available in Elastic. (Ashley, Rick)

. *Happy Robot Workflow Data Validation:* Reach out to Tracey to get a breakdown by week of which questions to ask in each queue and obtain the script (prompt) for the workflow. (Ashley)

. *Happy Robot Workflow Data Validation:* Notify Rene or Rick if any required data points are not available in Elastic so that an API can be built to access the 400 system if needed. (Ashley)

. *Happy Robot Workflow Backup:* Ask Happy Robot if it is possible to export or back up production workflows (e.g., to JSON) to ensure data safety in case of system issues. (Ashley, Rene);;;

Â  Â  Â  Â  account_description,
Â  Â  Â  Â  MAX(lease_own_status) as lease_own_status,
Â  Â  Â  Â  MIN(activation_date) AS activation_date,
Â  Â  Â  Â  MAX(deactivation_date) AS deactivation_date,
Â  Â  Â  Â  SUM(property_count) AS property_count,
Â  Â  Â  Â  SUM(mnt_amt) AS mnt_amt,
Â  Â  Â  Â  SUM(total_bldg_sf) AS total_bldg_sf
Â  Â  FROMÂ 
Â  Â  Â  Â  dev_ba.fac_mnt_hst_sqft
Â  Â  WHERE account_description like 'rent%' or account_description is null
Â  Â  GROUP BYÂ 
Â  Â  Â  Â  brand,
Â  Â  Â  Â  property_name,
Â  Â  Â  Â  region,
Â  Â  Â  Â  month_,
Â  Â  Â  Â  year_,
Â  Â  Â  Â  yr_mth,
Â  Â  Â  Â  account_description
)
SELECTÂ 
Â  Â  crnt.year_,
Â  Â  crnt.month_,
Â  Â  TRIM(crnt.brand) as brand,
Â  Â  TRIM(crnt.property_name) as property_name,
Â  Â  TRIM(crnt.region) as region,
Â  Â  crnt.account_description,
Â  Â  COALESCE(crnt.total_bldg_sf,0) AS total_bldg_sf,
Â  Â  crnt.property_count,
Â  Â  crnt.yr_mth,
Â  Â  COALESCE(crnt.mnt_amt,0) AS mnt_amt,
Â  Â  COALESCE(prev_year.mnt_amt,0) AS prev_year_mnt_amt,
Â  Â  COALESCE(prev_year.total_bldg_sf,0) AS prev_year_total_bldg_sf
FROMÂ 
Â  Â  sqft_grouped crnt
LEFT JOINÂ 
Â  Â  sqft_grouped prev_year
ONÂ 
Â  Â  crnt.brand = prev_year.brand
Â  Â  AND crnt.property_name = prev_year.property_name
Â  Â  AND crnt.region = prev_year.region
Â  Â  AND crnt.month_ = prev_year.month_
Â  Â  and crnt.account_description = prev_year.account_description
Â  Â  AND crnt.year_ = prev_year.year_ + 1
WHERE TRIM(crnt.property_name)='Kent'
ORDER BY crnt.yr_mth;;;

||{color:#172b4d}*Discovery Checklist*{color}| |
|*Status*|*Criteria to move to next status*|
|Ready| * Description required fields completed
 * Business owner identified|
|Define| * Quantitative value statements/KPIs added
 * Affected departments/stakeholders needed to write high-level requirements identified. (Tableau Report Champions needed if position user count > 20)|
|Share| * Report idea presented to BI Team
 * Alternate solutions and recommended approach if applicable.
 * Consensus to move forward to Report
 * Priority in Report list set|
|Schedule| * Project scheduled in roadmap.|
|Design| * Create Data Source
 * Design Tableau Report
 * Time and Cost Estimate|
|Approve| * User Testing 
 * Report Approved
 * Training plan established|
|Done| * Report Published |
|Track| * 30/60/90 Report Tracking Review Subtasks.
 * Review current results on report vs business owners intake established goal. 
 ** Report Usage
 ** Metric Goals and KPI success (Compared to the original intake goal.)|


 
||{color:#172b4d}*RICE Scoring* {color}|Description|Response|
|{*}R{*}each{color:#de350b}*{color}|_<number of report users/per (day or week)>{color:#de350b}*{color}_| |
|{*}I{*}mpact{color:#de350b}*{color}|_<Business Impact: massive (3), high (2), medium (1), low (0.5), minimal (0.25)>{color:#de350b}*{color}_| |
|{*}C{*}onfidence|_<Developer Confidence: high (100%), medium (80%), low (50%)>_| |
|{*}E{*}ffort|_Developer Efforts: 1 person 3 weeks = 120 hours_| |
|*RICE* score|(Reach x Impact x Confidence) / Effort    | |

| |

column172:
07/Aug/25 12:05 PM;Katey_harris@swifttrans.com;WITH cleaned_data AS (
Â  SELECTÂ 
Â  Â  TRIM(CAST(prop_id AS STRING)) AS prop_id,
Â  Â  TRIM(CAST(brand AS STRING)) AS brand,
Â  Â  TRIM(CAST(property_name AS STRING)) AS property_name,
Â  Â  CONCAT(TRIM(CAST(prop_id AS STRING)), TRIM(CAST(brand AS STRING)), TRIM(CAST(property_name AS STRING))) AS property,
Â  Â  TRIM(CAST(address AS STRING)) AS address,
Â  Â  TRIM(CAST(city AS STRING)) AS city,
Â  Â  TRIM(CAST(st AS STRING)) AS st,
Â  Â  TRIM(CAST(zip AS STRING)) AS zip,
Â  Â  status,
Â  Â  sc_id,
Â  Â  acq_method,
Â  Â  expansion_type,
Â  Â  deal_type,
Â  Â  own_lease,
Â  Â  doors,
Â  Â  acres,
Â  Â  price,
Â  Â  cost_per_door,
Â  Â  estimated_monthly_depreciation_per_rent,
Â  Â  startup_investment,
Â  Â  adj_cost_per_door,
Â  Â  CAST(TO_TIMESTAMP(acquisition_date, 'yyyy-MM-dd') AS DATE) AS acquisition_date,
Â  Â  activation_date,
Â  Â  deactivation_date,
Â  Â  notes,
Â  Â  insrt_ts
Â  FROM dev_ba.fac_ltl_prop_tracker_updt
Â  WHERE status <> 'Revenue'
),
date_bounds AS (
Â  SELECTÂ 
Â  Â  prop_id, brand, property_name,
Â  Â  CONCAT(TRIM(CAST(prop_id AS STRING)), TRIM(CAST(brand AS STRING)), TRIM(CAST(property_name AS STRING))) AS property,
Â  Â  TRUNC(MIN(acquisition_date), 'MM') AS start_month,
Â  Â  LEAST(
Â  Â  Â  TRUNC(MAX(CASEÂ 
Â  Â  Â  Â  WHEN deactivation_date IS NULL OR deactivation_date >= DATE '2200-01-01'Â 
Â  Â  Â  Â  THEN ADD_MONTHS(TRUNC(NOW(), 'YY'), 11)
Â  Â  Â  Â  ELSE deactivation_dateÂ 
Â  Â  Â  END), 'MM'),
Â  Â  Â  ADD_MONTHS(TRUNC(NOW(), 'YY'), 11)
Â  Â  ) AS end_month
Â  FROM cleaned_data
Â  GROUP BY prop_id, brand, property_name
),
month_scaffold AS (
Â  SELECTÂ 
Â  Â  db.property,
Â  Â  db.prop_id, db.brand, db.property_name,
Â  Â  TRUNC(CAST(CONCAT(r.yr_of_cal, '-', LPAD(r.mnth_of_yr, 2, '0'), '-01') AS DATE), 'MM') AS month_start
Â  FROM dev_ba.ref_date r
Â  JOIN date_bounds db
Â  Â  ON TRUNC(CAST(CONCAT(r.yr_of_cal, '-', LPAD(r.mnth_of_yr, 2, '0'), '-01') AS DATE), 'MM')
Â  Â  Â  Â BETWEEN db.start_month AND db.end_month
Â  WHERE r.yr_of_cal IS NOT NULL
Â  Â  AND r.mnth_of_yr IS NOT NULL
Â  Â  AND CAST(r.yr_of_cal AS INT) BETWEEN 2000 AND 2100
Â  Â  AND CAST(r.mnth_of_yr AS INT) BETWEEN 1 AND 12
),
first_record AS (
Â  SELECT *
Â  FROM (
Â  Â  SELECT *,
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY property ORDER BY insrt_ts ASC) AS rn
Â  Â  FROM cleaned_data
Â  ) sub
Â  WHERE rn = 1
),
joined AS (
Â  SELECTÂ 
Â  Â  m.property,
Â  Â  m.prop_id,
Â  Â  m.month_start,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.insrt_ts, f.insrt_ts) AS insrt_ts,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.sc_id, f.sc_id) AS sc_id,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.acq_method, f.acq_method) AS acq_method,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.expansion_type, f.expansion_type) AS expansion_type,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.deal_type, f.deal_type) AS deal_type,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.brand, f.brand) AS brand,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.property_name, f.property_name) AS property_name,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.address, f.address) AS address,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.city, f.city) AS city,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.st, f.st) AS st,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.zip, f.zip) AS zip,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.status, f.status) AS status,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.own_lease, f.own_lease) AS own_lease,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.doors, f.doors) AS doors,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.acres, f.acres) AS acres,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.price, f.price) AS price,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.cost_per_door, f.cost_per_door) AS cost_per_door,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.estimated_monthly_depreciation_per_rent, f.estimated_monthly_depreciation_per_rent) AS estimated_monthly_depreciation_per_rent,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.startup_investment, f.startup_investment) AS startup_investment,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.adj_cost_per_door, f.adj_cost_per_door) AS adj_cost_per_door,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.acquisition_date, f.acquisition_date) AS acquisition_date,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.activation_date, f.activation_date) AS activation_date,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.deactivation_date, f.deactivation_date) AS deactivation_date,
Â  Â  COALESCE(b.notes, f.notes) AS notes
Â  FROM month_scaffold m
Â  LEFT JOIN cleaned_data b ON m.property = b.property AND b.insrt_ts <= m.month_start
Â  LEFT JOIN first_record f ON m.property = f.property AND m.month_start < f.insrt_ts
),
ranked AS (
Â  SELECT *,
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â ROW_NUMBER() OVER (
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â PARTITION BY property, month_startÂ 
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â ORDER BY insrt_ts DESC
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â ) AS row_rank
Â  FROM joined
),
latest_status AS (
Â  SELECT *
Â  FROM cleaned_data
Â  WHERE insrt_ts = (SELECT MAX(insrt_ts) FROM cleaned_data)
)

-- Activation
SELECTÂ 
Â  r.month_start,
Â  s.property,
Â  s.prop_id,Â 
Â  s.sc_id,Â 
Â  s.acq_method,Â 
Â  s.expansion_type,Â 
Â  s.deal_type,Â 
Â  s.brand,Â 
Â  s.property_name,Â 
Â  s.address,Â 
Â  s.city,Â 
Â  s.st,
Â  s.zip,Â 
Â  s.status,Â 
Â  s.own_lease,Â 
Â  r.doors,Â 
Â  r.acres,Â 
Â  s.price,Â 
Â  s.cost_per_door,Â 
Â  s.estimated_monthly_depreciation_per_rent,Â 
Â  s.startup_investment,Â 
Â  s.adj_cost_per_door,Â 
Â  s.acquisition_date,Â 
Â  'Activation' AS date_type,
Â  a.dates,Â 
Â  s.notes,
Â  COALESCE(r.doors - LAG(r.doors) OVER (PARTITION BY r.property ORDER BY r.month_start), r.doors) AS doors_mom_diff,
Â  COALESCE(r.acres - LAG(r.acres) OVER (PARTITION BY r.property ORDER BY r.month_start), r.acres) AS acres_mom_diff
FROM ranked r
JOIN (
Â  SELECT property, MAX(activation_date) AS dates
Â  FROM ranked
Â  WHERE row_rank = 1Â 
Â  AND activation_date <> ''Â 
Â  AND activation_date <= LAST_DAY(TRUNC(NOW(), 'YEAR') + INTERVAL 11 MONTH)
Â  GROUP BY property
) a ON r.property = a.property
JOIN latest_status s ON r.property = s.property
WHERE r.row_rank = 1Â 
Â  AND r.activation_date <> ''
Â  AND r.prop_id = 'AC149'

UNION ALL

-- Deactivation
SELECTÂ 
Â  r.month_start,
Â  s.property,
Â  s.prop_id,Â 
Â  s.sc_id,Â 
Â  s.acq_method,Â 
Â  s.expansion_type,Â 
Â  s.deal_type,Â 
Â  s.brand,Â 
Â  s.property_name,Â 
Â  s.address,Â 
Â  s. city,Â 
Â  s.st,
Â  s.zip,Â 
Â  s.status,Â 
Â  s.own_lease,Â 
Â  r.doors,Â 
Â  r.acres,Â 
Â  s.price,Â 
Â  s.cost_per_door,Â 
Â  s.estimated_monthly_depreciation_per_rent,Â 
Â  s.startup_investment,Â 
Â  s.adj_cost_per_door,Â 
Â  s.acquisition_date,Â 
Â  'De-Activation' AS date_type,
Â  d.dates,Â 
Â  s.notes,
Â  COALESCE(r.doors - LAG(r.doors) OVER (PARTITION BY r.property ORDER BY r.month_start), r.doors) AS doors_mom_diff,
Â  COALESCE(r.acres - LAG(r.acres) OVER (PARTITION BY r.property ORDER BY r.month_start), r.acres) AS acres_mom_diff
FROM ranked r
JOIN (
Â  SELECT property, MAX(deactivation_date) AS dates
Â  FROM ranked
Â  WHERE row_rank = 1 AND deactivation_date NOT IN ('none', '2200-12-31')
Â  GROUP BY property
) d ON r.property = d.property
JOIN latest_status s ON r.property = s.property
WHERE r.row_rank = 1Â 
Â  AND r.deactivation_date NOT IN ('none', '2200-12-31')
Â  AND r.prop_id = 'AC149';;;

'-Marilyn noticed incorrect Violation Description on CSA Tableau report. Found that the AS400 table has only one row per Violation Code and the SQL DW table multiple rows per Violation Code, fixed query to bring in most recent etl_ts per Code to get most recent description only.

â€¢	SQL DW: [pstage].[dbo].[v_asft_isr7_sactlmsp_stg]

column172:
18/Jul/25 2:46 PM;Katey_harris@swifttrans.com;Â SELECTÂ 
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  TRIM(SACTLMSP.CLCODE4) AS "Violation Code",
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  LOWER(TRIM(SACTLMSP.CLDESC)) AS "Violation_Description",
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  SACTLMSP.CLCODE2,
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  CASEÂ 
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  WHEN TRIM(SACTLMSP.CLCODE2) = 'OTHER VIOLATIONS' OR TRIM(SACTLMSP.CLCODE2) = 'STATE/LOCAL LAW'Â 
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  THEN 'UNSAFE DRIVING'Â 
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  ELSE TRIM(SACTLMSP.CLCODE2)Â 
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  END AS [basic]
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  FROM [pstage].[dbo].[v_asft_isr7_sactlmsp_stg] SACTLMSPÂ 
INNER JOIN
(SELECT CLCODE4, MAX(etl_ts) as max_etl_ts
FROM [pstage].[dbo].[v_asft_isr7_sactlmsp_stg]
GROUP BY CLCODE4
)mcode ON mcode.CLCODE4=SACTLMSP.CLCODE4 and mcode.max_etl_ts=SACTLMSP.etl_ts
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  WHEREÂ 
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  SACTLMSP.CLCODE1 = 'VCRO'Â 
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  AND SACTLMSP.CLENDT = 0Â 
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  AND TRIM(SACTLMSP.CLCODE2) NOT IN ('MCMIS', 'COURT');;;

column1: Idle Fuel and Cost - Review logic
column29: Per Calen the logic is incorrect for idle fuel and cost. I will outline the differences in logic between the current implementation and the new logic requested. Following this, I will schedule a meeting with Tim Burks and Calen to confirm the proposed changes and ensure they meet our requirements.
column126: Waiting for John Oaks to get back with table that holds the data needed. Then will schedule meeting with Calen and Tim Burks.
column172: 08/Jul/25 8:25 AM;Ashley_cleavenger@swifttrans.com;We are currently getting the Idle Fuel Gallons from iesr7file.dpslgmpgdp. We are pulling field 'DMMCIFUL' which is IDLE FUEL. Then we are multiple that by 4.50.;;;
column173: 08/Jul/25 12:11 PM;Ashley_cleavenger@swifttrans.com;New Logic: Engine Hours X idle = hours of idle. Then multiple Hours of idle by .75 (which is the gallons of idle fuel burned per hour).Â  This will represent the gallons of fuel burned while idling. Then times gallons of fuel burned while idling by $4.50 which will give you the idle fuel cost.Â ;;;
column174: 31/Jul/25 12:47 PM;Ashley_cleavenger@swifttrans.com;Scheduled meeting for Monday 8/4/25 between Tim Burks, Calen Coughlin and Ruthie Young.Â ;;;
column175: 04/Aug/25 10:41 AM;Ashley_cleavenger@swifttrans.com;New data will be coming from iesr7file.mcspmsgx utilizing fields SPITTIM for trip idle time and SPTTIM for trip driving time. Calculation for *Engine hours* = trip idle time (SPITIM) + trip driving time (SPTTIM).Â  Calculation for *Idle%* = SPITIM / (SPITIM+SPTTIM). Calculation for {*}Gallons of fuel burned while idling{*}=Â  SPITTIM * 0.75(gallons of idle fuel burned per hour). Calculation for *Idle Fuel Cost* = Gallons of fuel burned while idling * 4.50 .;;;

column1: Handling Errors with Custom Views After Date Filter Updates in Tableau
column126:
'-When users inquire about discrepancies in report results, follow these steps:

-Explain the Issue:
Inform users that custom views may break when date functions are edited in the dashboard.
Clarify that this occurs because the custom views are trying to access date filters that no longer exist.

-Provide Guidance:
Advise users to avoid using saved custom views created before the dashboard updates.
Direct them to use the original view of the dashboard to ensure they are working with the latest filters.
-Offer a Solution:
Suggest deleting old custom views that reference outdated date filters.
Encourage users to recreate their custom views using the new filters.

-Link to Original View:
Provide a link to the original view of the dashboard for easy access.
column172:
24/Jun/25 9:13 AM;Katey_harris@swifttrans.com;h3. SOP: Handling Errors with Custom Views After Date Filter Updates in Tableau
h4. Purpose

This SOP aims to guide Tableau users on how to handle issues with custom views after a developer has updated the date filters on a published dashboard.
h4. Scope

This procedure applies to all users who create and use custom views in Tableau dashboards.
h4. Procedure
 # *Use the Original View*

 * 
 ** When accessing the dashboard, always start with the original view. This ensures that you are working with the most up-to-date filters and settings.

 # *Understanding the Issue*

 * 
 ** {*}Explanation{*}: Tableau does not produce a visible error message when a custom view tries to access a date filter that no longer exists. However, this can cause issues with the data displayed in your custom view.
 ** {*}Technical Note{*}: The underlying issue is that the custom view is attempting to reference a date filter that has been removed or updated by the developer.

 # *Identifying Affected Custom Views*

 * 
 ** If you notice discrepancies or unexpected results in your custom view, it is likely due to the outdated date filter.

 # *Deleting Old Custom Views*

 * 
 ** Navigate to the custom view that is causing issues.
 ** Delete the custom view to remove any references to the outdated date filter.

 # *Recreating Custom Views*

 * 
 ** Return to the original view of the dashboard.
 ** Apply the new date filters as needed.
 ** Save the new custom view with the updated filters.

 # *Best Practices*

 * 
 ** Regularly review and update your custom views to ensure they align with the latest dashboard updates.
 ** Pay attention to communications from BI developers to stay informed about any changes to the dashboard filters.

Â ;;;

column29: User is asking to identify when someone is overriding a target. This is to help improve service.
column126: User tested. View complete.
column172: 05/May/25 8:06 AM;Ashley_cleavenger@swifttrans.com;Suggest for the ask is possibly include the most recent 'ontime' override record in the Service Analysis reporting.Â ;;;
column173:
05/May/25 8:12 AM;Ashley_cleavenger@swifttrans.com;If the user agrees to include the data point in the Service Analysis reporting. Sample of query needed:Â 

select b.* FROM ( Select a.*, row_number() over(partition by a.tqord#, TQSTP# order by a.tgt_crt_dt desc, a.TQCRTTM desc) as row_nbr from ( Select tgt.*, cadatep.caisoe as tgt_crt_dt from iesr7file.TGTETAQP tgt LEFT JOIN iesr7file.cadatep cadatep on tgt.tqcrtdt = cadatep.caiso where TQOVRCD = 'ONTIME' and CADATEP.CAISOE between date('0001-01-01') + Year(Current Date) Years - 2 Year and current date ) as a) as b WHERE b.row_nbr = 1;;;
column174: 08/May/25 12:01 PM;Ashley_cleavenger@swifttrans.com;After discussing ideas with Liz. The most recent target eta override information will be hosted on the Predictive Service Model. Also there will be a view in the Service Analysis report to highlight the most recent target eta override code associated with the load.Â ;;;
column175:
12/May/25 8:56 AM;Ashley_cleavenger@swifttrans.com;Correct code sent to Keagen:Â 

SELECTÂ b.*
FROMÂ (
Â Â  SELECTÂ a.*,Â 
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  ROW_NUMBER()Â OVERÂ (
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  PARTITIONÂ BYÂ a.tqord#,Â a.TQSTP#Â 
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  ORDERÂ BYÂ a.tgt_crt_dtÂ DESC,Â a.TQCRTTMÂ DESC
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â )Â ASÂ row_nbr
Â Â  FROMÂ (
Â Â Â Â Â Â  SELECTÂ tgt.*,Â 
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â cadatep.caisoeÂ ASÂ tgt_crt_dt
Â Â Â Â Â Â  FROMÂ iesr7file.TGTETAQPÂ tgt
Â Â Â Â Â Â  LEFTÂ JOINÂ iesr7file.cadatepÂ cadatepÂ 
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  ONÂ tgt.tqcrtdtÂ =Â cadatep.caiso
Â Â Â Â Â Â  WHEREÂ cadatep.caisoeÂ BETWEENÂ DATE('0001-01-01')Â +Â YEAR(CURRENTÂ DATE)Â YEARSÂ -Â 2Â YEARÂ 
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  ANDÂ CURRENTÂ DATE
Â Â Â )Â ASÂ a
)Â ASÂ b
WHEREÂ b.row_nbrÂ =Â 1;;;
column176: 27/May/25 12:32 PM;Ashley_cleavenger@swifttrans.com;Helpdesk Ticket# 446537 has been created for ETL to stage table iesr7file.tgtetaqp;;;
column177: 09/Jun/25 3:10 PM;Ashley_cleavenger@swifttrans.com;Dev stage table tested and everything looks good. Nick is going to publish on Prod.Â ;;;
column178:
30/Jun/25 9:58 AM;Ashley_cleavenger@swifttrans.com;Need to review logic and path of adding data to the service data with Keagen and Ty. Will add the last target eta code information in the stop off subquery in the stored procedure for service_ext.Â 
Â 
SELECT
Â  Â  v_edw_stopoff.ordr_nbr,
Â  Â  CAST(v_edw_stopoff.stpf_nbr AS int) AS STPF_NBR,
Â  Â  v_edw_stopoff.apt_erly_dt,
Â  Â  CAST(v_edw_stopoff.apt_erly_tm AS time) AS early_apt_tm,
Â  Â  CAST(apt_erly_dt AS DATETIME) + CAST(v_edw_stopoff.apt_erly_tm AS DATETIME) AS apt_early_datetime,
Â  Â  v_edw_stopoff.apt_lt_dt,
Â  Â  CAST(v_edw_stopoff.apt_lt_tm AS time) AS Late_apt_tm,
Â  Â  CAST(apt_lt_dt AS DATETIME) + CAST(v_edw_stopoff.apt_lt_tm AS DATETIME) AS apt_late_datetime,
Â  Â  v_edw_stopoff.arvl_dt,
Â  Â  CAST(v_edw_stopoff.arvl_tm AS time) AS arvl_tm,
Â  Â  CAST(arvl_dt AS DATETIME) + CAST(arvl_tm AS DATETIME) AS arrival_datetime,
Â  Â  CAST(v_edw_stopoff.disp_nbr AS CHAR) AS disp_nbr ,
TQOVRCD as tgt_eta_override_cd,
TQOVRUSR as tgt_eta_user,
tgt_crt_dt
FROM pCORE.dbo.v_edw_stopoff v_edw_stopoff
LEFT JOIN
Â 
(SELECT b.*
FROM (
Â  Â  SELECT a.*,Â 
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â ROW_NUMBER() OVER (
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â PARTITION BY a.tqord#, a.TQSTP#Â 
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â ORDER BY a.tgt_crt_dt DESC, a.TQCRTTM DESC
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â ) AS row_nbr
Â  Â  FROM (
Â  Â  Â  Â  SELECT tgt.*, CASEÂ 
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â WHEN LEN(CONVERT(VARCHAR(8), TQCRTDT)) = 8 AND ISDATE(CONVERT(VARCHAR(8), TQCRTDT)) = 1 THEN
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â CONVERT(VARCHAR(10), CAST(CONVERT(VARCHAR(8), TQCRTDT) AS DATE), 120)
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â ELSE NULL
Â  Â  Â  Â END AS tgt_crt_dt
Â  Â  Â  Â  FROM pstage.dbo.v_asft_isr7_tgtetaqp_stg tgt
Â  Â  ) AS a
) AS b
WHERE b.row_nbr = 1) tgtetaqp on v_edw_stopoff.ordr_nbr = tgtetaqp.TQORD# and v_edw_stopoff.stpf_nbr = tgtetaqp.TQSTP# */
WHERE v_edw_stopoff.stpf_nbr > 0
Â  AND v_edw_stopoff.apt_erly_dt >= DATEADD(YEAR, DATEDIFF(YEAR, 0, GETDATE()) - 1, 0);;;

column29:
The Tableau report should cover optimization of backhaul lanes, focusing on reducing deadhead miles and layover costs by analyzing and redirecting freight from Florida and other origins to alternative destinations.
 * The report should visualize the impact of dropping top deadhead destinations and adding optimized new destinations, showing cost savings and potential profitability improvements.
 * Highlight the process of automating the analysis, with clear identification of which columns/fields are essential for reporting, as Gizem is preparing a highlighted version for this purpose.

Key metrics to include: median total miles per dispatch, total revenue, dispatch count, billed and non-revenue counts, deadhead count and miles, bid all-in rate, six-week order/bid data, and projected added loads.

Attached is most recent copy of dataset Giz can answer any questions about it
column126: The dataset referenced in the meeting is the same as mentioned in the Jira ticket, with Gizem as the point of contact for questions. The dataset includes additional details and origins outside of Florida, aligning with the project's expansion beyond the initial Florida focus.

column172:
26/Feb/25 3:53 PM;Brice_white@swifttrans.com;{code:java}
select count(id) as trlr_cnt ,Â 
last_cust_code
from (
SELECT id ,Â 
-- company ,Â 
TRIM(last_ops_event_customer_code) as last_cust_code ,
row_number() over (partition by id order by last_modified_timestamp desc) as rn
FROM fbx_trailers_hstÂ 
--where id = '103241|swift'
where trim(last_ops_event_customer_code) is not null
and last_ops_event_customer_code <> ' Â  Â  Â '
and last_ops_event_customer_code <> ' '
--LIMIT 100
) as trlr
where trlr.rn = 1
group by last_cust_code {code};;;

column126: P drive report wanted on tableau for AM action items.
column172:
09/Jun/25 2:11 PM;Brice_white@swifttrans.com;Currently we do not have a discrepancy queue report on Tableau that I'm aware of...Â  This is found via the P drive. The report will tell me what shipments are in queue and the shipper's profile has not been met based on the shipper repository pattern on file.
Otherwise it would require leadership to pull up each team member by the as400 menu- 13- 64, enter their username in the Select Resp CSR field.
Â 
Our goal is addressing all shipments in queue within 2 days or less. Anything at 3 days or greater is outside of goal.

column29: Review all the emails from Christina's reviews on from Knight to all other brands and all other brands to Knight.
column126:
Christina sent feedback and questions on some loads 2024-12-20.  Looked into those during the holidays and was able to make a slight change to the duplicates workflow to not eliminate the orders she said were missing.
2025-01-24 - Meeting to discuss two orders still missing and a discrepancy in the LOB for Knight.
2025-03-03 - Met with Christina, Aditya, and Alexander at Abilene.  ETL will be creating additional tables to get historical unbilled and reversals from a monthly file sent by Abilene/Barr-Nunn respectively.

column126:
8/25/25- work on python solution to automate power point creations by brand for all active projects. export each program 1st 3 slides as images to embed in power point. title power point accordingly, embed change report as scrollable excel.
8/19/25- John removed some filters on the Procore Portfolio report...hope this fixes missing data points
8/15/25-refreshed with cosmetic fixes. still need investigate missing data points.
8/13/25 Funky data still missing, look for missing link, John says data is in power bi, so reports have data (need to check kapow, etl and query). need solution that creates decks by brand to share with each brand.
6/27/25 Procore portfolio table missing projects. updated join to allow to show projects even if missing portfolio status and details
6/24/25 ETL updated. To John for review
